comments.creator: gps@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
As part of send tab to device, we need a list of client names available in the UX so the user can select which device to send to. Unfortunately, these currently aren't available until after the first sync on application startup is performed, effectively making the feature unavailable.

I'm pretty sure this is beyond our pain threshold for user experience, so I'm requesting that clients data somehow be cached and made available before first sync. If we WONTFIX this, the alternative is having the send tab to device context menu automatically kick off a sync when selected. We'd then need a spinner or something and wait until the sync has finished.

Data that is needed:

* Client ID
* Client name

comments.author: bugzilla@twinql.com
comments.creator: bugzilla@twinql.com
comments.raw_text:
Agreed that this would be confusing and unpleasant UX.

Things worth thinking about:

* Tabs From Other Computers is similarly greyed-out until first sync, and loading about:sync-tabs prompts a sync. (It used to sync just the clients and tabs engines directly, but that has its own problems.)

* From one perspective, caching would be great: we could partially populate other clients-based UI like TFOC.

* From another perspective, perhaps this implies that we ought to solve Bug 584771, putting the app in charge of initializing Sync, and then have the UI prompt a full or partial sync to fetch a list of clients.

* It certainly doesn't make sense to expose the UI for Send Tab if we're unable to communicate successfully with our Sync server, does it?
